zone.line: surely a new soul wihin within me,
and my blood riots through my veins:
I am burnt up with fever. But
these are precious moments; devil
as I am become, yet that is my Ma-
thilda before me whom I love as
one was never before loved: And she
knows it now; she listens to these
words which I thought, fool as I was,
would blast her to death. Come, come,
the worst is past: no more grief, tears
or despair; were not those the words
you uttered? – We have leapt the
chasme I told you of, and now, mark
me, Mathilda, we are to find flowers,
and verdure and delight; or is it hell,
and fire, and tortures? Oh! Beloved
One, I am borne away; I can no longer
sustain myself; surely this is death that
is coming. Let me lay my head near
your heart; let me die in your arms!" –
He sunk to the earth fainting, while I,
nearly as lifeless, gazed on him in
despair.
